title: Resume
content:
Philip N. Hagelberg

techno!nospamthankyou!mancy@gmail.com

Work Experience

Web Developer Evri, Seattle, WA

[August 2007 - present]

Web Developer i5 Labs, San Fransisco, CA

  • Build a social networking site in Rails with a small team.
  • Used test-driven techniques to ensure stability and quality.

[December 2006 - August 2007]

Lead Developer Ujive, Los Angeles, CA

  • Refactored a beleaguered Rails concert search application by adding tests, reducing LOC count, and enforcing cleanliness in the code base.

[July 2006 - October 2006]

Lead Developer Paxtel, Yakima, WA

  • Created a test-driven Rails web application to view diagnostics and map location of fleets of vehicles.
  • Maintained a dedicated Debian GNU/Linux server.
  • Connected the application to a nationwide RF network by handling a proprietary socket-level vehicle communications protocol.

[August 2005 - October 2006]

Skills

I have been programming computers since 1995.

Specifically:
Languages
Proficient in (X)HTML, Ruby, Emacs LISP, and ECMAScript (aka Livescript or Javascript). Experience in Common LISP, Scheme, SQL, PHP, XUL, Python, and CSS.
Operating Systems
GNU/Linux since 2003 on the server and desktop; Mac OS X from 1990 - 2003. Smatterings of FreeBSD.
Tools
Knowledgeable concerning Rails, GNU Emacs, Test::Unit, RSpec, jQuery, Prototype, Git, Subversion, hoe, Vlad the Deployer, Firefox extensions, nginx, Lighttpd, Mongrel, and more.

Related Experience

  • Speaker at RubyConf 2007.
    Gave a talk titled 'Tightening the Feedback Loop' and focused on ways that programmers could be more attentive of the state of their code. Those ideas spawned the augment project. The talk was recorded by ConFreaks.

  • Implemented Bus Scheme:
    Wrote a Scheme interpreter in Ruby (mostly while riding the bus) capable of serving web applications and integrating Ruby libraries. I discovered and fixed a number of Rubinius bugs in the process.

  • Wrote and maintained Concourse:
    Came up with and coded a web application for RailsDay '06 with a bit of help from two collaborators on another continent. Wrote a complete comprehensive test suite (test-to-code ratio greater than one) and continued development in a test-driven manner.

  • Initiated and contributed to several other Free Software projects:
    Roast Beef, ElUnit, Rinari, RPlanet, RAV, Ebby, RuseMail, and Behave.el are all projects I started. I've also had a few patches accepted into GNU Emacs, Rails, Ruby, Rubinius, Cartographer, Conkeror.

  • Systems Administrator of Biola University's Linux lab:
    Responsible for the installation and maintenance of a set of GNU/Linux machines running Ubuntu. Upkept a server for students' web and database needs as well as a seperate server for network services such as NFS and NIS.
    [July 2004 - May 2005]


References and further work samples available upon request.

Education

Biola University, La Mirada, CA (2001 - 2005)
Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science
Graduate of the Torrey Honors Institute
Magna Cum Laude

Voraciously self-taught

Spoken Languages

  • Native English speaker
  • Understand Indonesian/Malaysian
